definition: Pierre Trudeau (1919-2000), prime minister of Canada 1980-1984 and 1968-1979/Justin Trudeau (1971-), prime minister of Canada from 2015
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
(bound form) crass/stupid/rude/(used to represent the sounds of "ru", "lu" etc in loanwords)
surname Lu/Lu, ancient state of China 魯國|鲁国[Lu3 guo2]/Lu, short name for Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"

sentences.english: Add an exciting flavor to your day, with Trudeau.
sentences.chinese: 新增一個令人興奮的味道，你的一天，特魯多。

sentences.english: But hey let's have Trudeau write an IQ test and see.
sentences.chinese: 但是讓特魯多進行智商測試，看看結果如何。

sentences.english: Trudeau's Set of 3 Measuring Cups neatly nests within one another when storing.
sentences.chinese: 特魯多的3量杯內設置整齊巢彼此當存儲。

sentences.english: By Trudeau, a company that develops visionary products.
sentences.chinese: 通過特魯多，一個有遠見的公司，開發的產品。
